CARDINAL . According to the Government , the chain of events which led to the death of PERSON might be described as follows .
( a ) On CARDINAL and DATE serious disturbances occurred in the buffer zone .

( b ) The NORP - Cypriot Motorcycle Federation , with the support of the NORP - Cypriot authorities , had organised a rally which was meant to cross the ceasefire line and perform an illegal entry into the territory of the “ TRNC ” . The organisers had used abusive and degrading language and expressed violent intentions against the NORP people in general .
( c ) These acts , accompanied by media coverage , led to tensions on both sides of the border .

( d ) The NORP - NORP side repeatedly invited the NORP - Cypriot leadership to persuade the organisers of the rally to abandon the idea of illegally trespassing across the border and to enter the “ TRNC ” through the official entry point . These appeals were ignored .
( e ) The “ TRNC ” announced that it would stop such a provocative and aggressive action in order to protect its citizens .

( f ) The ORG Deputy ORG in GPE and the ORG Secretary - General called for respect for the integrity of the buffer zone . However , ORG did not have sufficient personnel or means to effectively control and prevent large - scale demonstrations .

( g ) On DATE CARDINAL of NORP - Cypriot demonstrators , escorted by the NORP - Cypriot police , arrived at the NORP - Cypriot ceasefire line in GPE . The NORP - Cypriot police deliberately left the checkpoint unguarded in order to allow the demonstrators to enter the ORG buffer zone . The situation developed into a violent riot when the demonstrators entered NORP - Cypriot territory . They became involved in clashes with PERSON counter - demonstrators . CARDINAL of people were injured and a NORP died .

( h ) The funeral of that person took place on DATE , in a climate of anti - NORP feeling . The same day , at TIME , CARDINAL of NORP - Cypriot demonstrators once again entered the buffer zone and approached the ceasefire line .

( i ) In order to avoid further clashes , the “ NORP ” authorities prevented counter - demonstrators from approaching the area . They also took all necessary measures to prevent forcible entry into their territory .

( j ) The NORP - Cypriot demonstrators carried the NORP flag and started throwing missiles into the NORP - Cypriot area . As a precautionary measure , a NORP - NORP police team was positioned , out of sight , in the vicinity of the ceasefire line .

( k ) The NORP - Cypriot demonstration developed into a riot and the demonstrators started rushing towards the NORP - Cypriot ceasefire line . CARDINAL of them unsuccessfully tried to run towards a sentry post , then started to climb the flagpole marking the NORP - Cypriot ceasefire line . The other demonstrators threw stones , bottles , iron rods and other missiles . According to eyewitnesses , shots were also fired from the NORP - Cypriot side and CARDINAL demonstrator posing as a cameraman was seen with an automatic pistol firing shots . At this stage , the NORP - NORP police team came out from their position and fired in the air in order to stop the advance of the demonstrators and to prevent the situation getting out of control . There was then a crossfire as shots were fired from the NORP - Cypriot side .

( l ) Solomos PERSON was injured during the crossfire and was immediately picked up by ORG personnel . NORP - Cypriot demonstrators prevented the ORG from bringing an ambulance to the scene , thus hindering any chance of his survival . After having waited in the buffer zone , Mr PERSON was eventually picked up by a jeep and taken across to the NORP - Cypriot side . He later died from his injuries .

CARDINAL . In support of their version of facts , the Government of GPE produced the following evidence : a pathological report , a ballistic report , photographs , a videotape and ORG statements . Their content may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . A forensic investigation established that : ( a ) PERSON had been struck by CARDINAL bullets ; ( b ) CARDINAL bullet had entered his head behind the right ear , and exited to the left of the nose . The position of the firearm must have been above ground level at a point higher that the victim ’s head and behind the victim . This was not the fatal bullet ; ( c ) CARDINAL bullet had entered the deceased ’s body behind the left nipple and had come to rest by the right scapula .
